bio.p: Jonathan E. Halpert is an assistant professor at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology. He received his B.S. in Chemistry from Tufts University (2003) and Ph.D. in Physical Chemistry from MIT (2008). He was a postdoctoral fellow at CAS‚ÄêIPE in Beijing and in the Optoelectronics Group at the University of Cambridge and later was a senior lecturer, Rutherford Discovery Fellow, and PI in the MacDiarmid Institute at Victoria University of Wellington. His research interests include nanocrystals, and quantum dots, especially perovskites, in optoelectronic devices, including memristors, batteries, solar cells, photodetectors and LEDs.
